channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for RI

item.title: Report I-2023100035
item.description:
Report I-2023100035

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-06
  • City: Kent
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During unloading operation consignee employees connected hose to storage tank that did not have the capacity for the load. Storage tank high level sensor failed to operate resulting in overfill of the storage tank. Consignee halted operation and connected unloading hose to secondary storage tank to complete unloading. Plant personnel cleaned up released material from tank area.

item.title: Report I-2023100007
item.description:
Report I-2023100007

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-13T18:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: Dalton
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived to deliver a bulk load of VM&P to MFG in Dalton, GA. Customer informed driver that they would complete unload process, driver returned to the cab of his truck. Customer employee began sample taking process and checked that external valve was closed before opening internal valve to take sample. Upon opening internal valve, an estimated quantity of approximately 50 gallons was released unexpectedly out of the hose connection point and into the customers containment area. Probable cause is external valve failure. Tanker will be fully inspected to confirm.
